arts.ttl: Palace end winless run with victory over in-form Brentford
arts.sum: Crystal Palace end a three-match winless run in the Premier League with victory over in-form Brentford at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: Palace won 'set-play battle' against Brentford - Glasner
arts.sum: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner says his side performed well at both ends of the pitch to execute and defend set plays in their 2-0 win at home to Brentford.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner hails set-piece preparation as Crystal Palace see off Brentford
arts.sum: The Eagles scored from a free-kick and a long throw in their 2-0 win.

arts.ttl: Jean-Philippe Mateta sets Crystal Palace on road to victory over Brentford
arts.sum: Jean-Philippe Mateta’s eighth goal of the season set Crystal Palace on course for a return to winning ways in the Premier League. Mateta’s opener on the half-hour was added to by an own goal from the Brentford captain, Nathan Collins, early in the second half as the Eagles backed up their win at Liverpool in the Carabao Cup on Wednesday with their first victory in four league games. Palace’s Ismaïla Sarr looked to have forged an opportunity for himself when he got away from Kristoffer Ajer down the right but chose to square the ball rather than shoot and Sepp van den Berg intercepted for Brentford. It was a rare opening in what was a cagey beginning, with Mateta’s deflected header from a Yéremy Pino cross gently falling into the arms of Caoimhín Kelleher. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Mateta on target again as Palace defeat London rivals Brentford!
arts.sum: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Crystal Palace’s match against Brentford in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace back to winning ways as Brentford fail to fire
arts.sum: Jean-Philippe Mateta’s header and Nathan Collins’ own goal settled the match.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace 2-0 Brentford: Jean-Philippe Mateta scores as Oliver Glasner's Eagles end three-match winless streak
arts.sum: Report and free match highlights from the Premier League match between Crystal Palace and Brentford at Selhurst Park; a header from Jean-Philippe Mateta and an own goal from Bees captain Nathan Collins earn Oliver Glasners Eagles a first league win in four

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace vs Brentford – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Crystal Palace return to Selhurst Park today, still buzzing from one of their great cup victories. Indeed, the Eagles put in a stunning performance on Wednesday, beating Liverpool 3-0 at Anfield in the Carabao Cup. Now, manager Oliver Glasner will demand that same level of performance back in the league. arts.ttl: Brentford XI vs Crystal Palace – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Brentford travel to Selhurst Park on Saturday in superb form, aiming for a third consecutive Premier League victory. This confidence comes after impressive recent wins against Manchester United (3-1) and league champions Liverpool (3-2). Furthermore, they are going to the match after a morale-boosting 5-0 win in the Carabao Cup midweek.
